messages.title: Tay Launches Community Projects
messages.content: Pavements for the People: Tay and her team are listening to complaints about parked vehicles crowding streets and footpaths.

messages.title: Alternative Winter Market
messages.content: November 30th, 11AM - 4PM. Have Yourself a Greener, Litter Christmas with Make & Mend market.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Join the Litter Picking Crew to keep Fenham clean, focusing on reducing litter and dangerous broken glass around the local park and street.
Organizing an Alternative Christmas Market on Nov 30th at Denton Burn Community Centre to encourage sustainable living and reduce waste.
Addressing and tackling the problem of excessive pavement parking causing difficulties for the community.

issues.environment: Tay is tackling dangerous road speeds, illegal waste dumping, and fly-tipping to improve local environment.
issues.governance: Local councils have powers to introduce restrictions - why is Newcastle's Council not doing this in residential areas?

housing.content: Excessive pavement parking is causing difficulties when crossing the road or maneuvering in and out of driveways.

leaflet.personalStatement: Tay Pitman updates Fenham on her work acting on your concerns this autumn!

quotes.text: From tackling dangerous road speeds, to tackling measures to reduce litter and calling for an end to pavement street parking, I've been acting on your concerns this autumn!

images.caption: Tay Pitman with the Green Litter-Pick Team
Tay campaigning against the new drive-though fast food chain on Westgate Road
